CatDescriptText: Mrs. Emma Jackson, housewife, Homewood, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 5, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were advising a Negro high school student, who plans to enter college and is seeking help on choosing a vocation, what field would you suggest that he or she seek as a vocation?" Answer reads: "I would suggest that any student entering college for the first time this fall should consider studying medicine.  We do not have enough doctors as it is and in my opinion we need more of them to help keep our health standards high."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Emma Jackson wearing earrings and light colored sleeveless blouse with ribbon on left shoulder, holding paper bag under left arm, standing in front of light colored wall
